intro: Prosthechea ionophlebia, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic epiphytic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy, red berries. Prosthechea ionophlebia is notable for its ability to derive some of its nutrients from host trees, making it an important component of tropical forest ecosystems.
